Re: License #: CB410201260
SI #: 2025SIC0000469
Dear Ms. Schultz:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, area manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000469
Special Investigation Intake Date: March 14, 2025
License #: CB410201260
Licensee Group Organization: Wellspring Lutheran Services
Licensee Designee: Jason Sroufe
Chief Administrator: Kathleen Schultz
Agency Name: WELLSPRING LUTHERAN SERVICES
KENTWOOD
Agency Address: 1715 Sutherland DR
Kentwood, MI 49508-3306
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 06/28/2026

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12420 Updated service plans
Section • (1) An updated service plan, as required in R
Description 400.12418(2)(b), must include all the following
information:
• (c) A summary of information pertinent to the
updated services plan received since the last service
plan from the child, the child's parents or legal
guardian, foster parents, referring agency, and
others, unless the agency documents why any of
these entities cannot be involved.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There are concerns that the agency does not appropriately
communicate with the school regarding a foster child's needs.
Investigation Principal was interviewed on 3/17/2025, via telephone
conference in attendance with School Social Worker. Principal
reported Foster Child A (FC A) was dropped off at school on
9/3/24 by Birth Father and had scars from a brain surgery along
with a traumatic brain injury (TBI). She reported the school
received no information regarding FC A’s needs. Principal
reported the school needed a court order and FC A’s treatment
plan.
School Social Worker was interviewed on 3/17/2025, via
telephone conference. She reported her concerns are the same
as Principal. She added that she observed FC A’s hyperactive
behavior such as excessive energy, impulsivity, difficulty focusing,
not following directions in the classroom from her teacher as well
as restlessness. She reported she would have liked to have
known FC A’s treatment plan.
Chief Administrator was interviewed via telephone on 3/19/25.
She apologized for not responding timely to the email sent to her
2

by this Consultant. She reported Assigned Supervisor had
resigned from the agency. She reported she would contact
Associate Division Director to assist in scheduling an interview
with the assigned foster care worker. She had no additional
information.
Foster Care Worker (FCW) was interviewed on 5/5/2025 via
telephone. FCW reported FC A’s case was assigned to
Wellspring on 8/22/2024. He reported Wellspring completed FC
A’s Initial service plan (ISP) from 8/22/2024 – 9/19/2024. He
reported this plan described the reason FC A and her siblings
entered into care, services provided to the children and parents to
reunify the family, or finalize the permanency plan for FC A, and
Birth Mother and Birth Father. FCW reported there were three
Updated Service Plans written by himself. He reported in each
plan there were updates regarding relevant information received
from the last service plan written. FCW reported each report
provided a summary of treatment goals and action steps occurring
for FC A and her parents. He reported these goals and action
steps were followed by the parents, FC A and her Foster Parent.
An example of the progress reports, in the Updated Service Plan
dated 9/20/2024 – 12/2/2024, included FCW reported Birth Mother
supervised parental visits were discontinued due to being
incarcerated. He said prior, Birth Mother attended all parental
visits with FC A weekly that was supervised in the community.
FCW reported he sent a School Notification DHS 942 School
Form to FC A’s school via mail along with FC A’s court order on
9/5/2024. He reported he informed the school personnel that FC
A is currently placed in foster care, living in out- of- home care.
The letter stated to accept the documentation to enroll FC A within
the school system. FCW said he introduced himself as the
assigned FCW in the letter and reported that he would be actively
involved in FC A’s educational planning. He reported he also sent
the court order dated 8/22/2024 with this school notification. FCW
reported a TDM was held on 10/4/2024 where FCA A’s case was
discussed in detail and the Principal and School Social Worker
were in attendance. He reported at the TDM Principal reported
the school never received the mail. FCW said immediately after
the TDM meeting he sent the notification form and the court order
to the school and followed up with a phone call that the
information had been received, and the answer was yes.
FCW reported he reached out to School Social Worker on
3/20/2025, requesting a meeting to discuss any concerns the
school had regarding FC A’s case because he felt it would be
3

beneficial for all involved to come together to discuss what is best
for FC A. He reported the response came back from Principal
stating they have been expressing their concerns since October
2024. FCW said Principal stated in an email that the school
personnel would love to meet regarding FC A and that the school
facts did not seem to be in alignment with Wellspring’s facts. FCW
reported Principal stated the school personnel will follow up with a
Doodle Poll to find a date/time that works for all and that it would
likely be after spring break which was the week of March 31st.
In review of documentation by this Consultant, there was a total of
four service plans were completed by Wellspring’s agency FCW.
All Updated service plans included pertinent and new information
for FC A and her parents.
Document reviewed:
• Foster Child A’s (FC A) case information in MiSACWiS.
Assigned and placed with Wellspring Lutheran Services
8/22/2024 as a temporary court ward. She was involved in
a serious car accident.
• All Updated service plans (4) are summarized and provided
updated information in each of the services plans reviewed.
The Updated service plans reviewed were dated as follows:
8/22/2024 – 9/19/2024 Initial updated service plan; and
Updated service plans; 9/20/2024 -12/2/2024 12/3/2024 –
2/26/2025; and 2/27/2025 – 5/7/2025.
• Updated service plan completed by FCW dated 12/3/2024
– 2/26/2025, provided detailed information regarding
assessment of progress in achieving the permanency goal
for FC A. The FCW had a meeting with the Placement
Collaboration Unit (PCU) on FC A’s wellbeing. Principal as
well as School Social Worker was in attendance with this
meeting. The report summarized reasons for the
assessment of individual barriers to reunification.
Recommended court orders were also discussed in this
report. This updated service plan provided the permanency
goal for twelve months for FC A. The permanency goal of
reunification beyond twelve months is to return FC A to her
family with additional services that will be needed to reunify
the family.
• MiSACWIS – School notification letter from FCW to FC A’s
school dated 9/5/2024 informing the school personnel that
FC A is currently placed in foster care, living in out- of-
home care. The letter stated to accept the documentation
to enroll FC A within the school system. FCW introduced
himself as the assigned FCW in the letter and reported that
4

he would be actively involved in FC A’s educational
planning.
Analysis Based on interview with the FCW and documentation of the Initial
service plan and all other Updated service plans mentioned
above, included new and relevant information pertaining to FC A’s
case and involved applicable parties including school personnel.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12420 Updated service plans
Section • (1) An updated service plan, as required in R
Description 400.12418(2)(b), must include all the following information:
• (d) Assessment of progress in achieving the
permanency goal for the child.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation
There are concerns that the foster care agency is not
appropriately assessing safety for Foster Child A before
reunifying.
Investigation Principal was interviewed on 3/17/2025, via telephone
conference in attendance with School Social Worker. Principal
stated she did not feel the agency was adequately addressing
safety concerns for Foster Child A before reunification. Principal
was concerned with Birth Father’s drinking and Birth Mother in
Birth Father’s home having unsupervised visits with FC A as
heard from community members. Principal mentioned FC A has
behavioral challenges when returned from the care of Birth Father
and believes this is cause for concern in reunification.
School Social Worker was interviewed on 3/17/2025, via
telephone conference. She reported that her concerns are the
same as Principal mentioned above.
Chief Administrator was interviewed via telephone on 3/19/25.
She provided the contact information for the associate division
director to assist in scheduling an interview with the assigned
foster care worker.
5

The Associate División Director contacted this Consultant via
email on 3/19/2025. She reported contact information for the
assigned FCW. She reported the assigned supervisor had
recently left the agency and that the person to interview on the
case is the assigned FCW as he was assigned the case when
Wellspring accepted the case assignment. She had no additional
information.
Foster Care Worker (FCW) was interviewed on 5/5/2025 via
telephone. He reported FC A’s case was transferred to
Wellspring’s agency on 8/22/2025 and he was assigned FC A’s
case 8/27/2025. He reported FC A was made a temporary court
ward on 8/22/2025.
FCW reported there was a Team Decision Making (TDM) meeting
on 10/4/2024 that included numerous people involved on FC A’s
case. He reported Principal, School Social Worker, Birth Mother,
Birth Father, potential new Foster Parent, and others were all
involved in this meeting to discuss FC A’s case.
FCW reported he reached out to School Social Worker on
3/20/25, requesting a meeting to discuss any concerns the school
had regarding FC A’s case because he felt it would be beneficial
for all involved to come together to discuss what is best for FC A.
He reported the response came back from the principal stating
they have been expressing their concerns since October 2024.
FCW said Principal stated the school personnel would love to
meet regarding FC A and school facts did not seem to be in
alignment with Wellspring’s facts. FCW reported Principal stated
the school personnel will follow up with a Doodle Poll to find a
date/time that works for all and that it would likely be after spring
break which was the week of March 31st. FCW reported he had a
meeting with the school personnel on 1/31/2025 and provided
them with all the updated court reports.
FCW reported appropriately assessing safety for FC A before
reunifying for her permanency plan is included in her updated
service plans. FCW reported Principal concerns with FC A’s
reunifying with her Birth Father was addressed in an in - person
meeting held 1/31/2025, with Principal and School Social Worker.
He reported in this meeting, he reported Birth Father has
submitted to drug screening, had a psychological evaluation,
attending counseling sessions, substance abuse assessment and
drug screens which produced positive results. FCW reported Birth
Father has not missed any of his meetings required. FCW
reported he has visited the home where Birth Father lives and the
6

house is clean and bedroom where FC A sleeps is appropriate
with applicable bedding. FCW reported Birth Father is attending
parenting classes and making sure FC A is not missing any
doctor’s appointments. He reported Birth Father has a temporary
permit to drive FC A back and forth to her doctor’s appointment.
FCW also reported Birth Father is in constant contact with him
(FCW) if Birth Father needs any assistance or if he runs into any
issues with parenting FC A or transporting her to her
appointments.
Foster Parent (FP) was interviewed on 5/5/2025 via telephone.
She reported she initially had the same concerns about FC A and
her Birth Father as Principal and School Social Worker as she
worked closely with the school. She reported when FC A was
placed in her home on 10/4/2024, she had many inappropriate
behaviors such as using inappropriate language i.e. cuss words,
fighting, kicking, biting, and disrespecting all directions. FP
reported as time with FC A continued in her home, she noticed a
big change in FC A because she would focus on redirecting FC A
with good behaviors. FP reported she was in contact with the
FCW, and the school and that FC A had many resources put in
place to assist her. FP identified many services put in place for
FC A. She reported FC A is attending all of her doctor’s
appointments. FP reported that FC A’s unsupervised visits with
Birth Father are going well, and she is comfortable with his
progress as well. She said she no longer fears for FC A’s safety
when she is with her Birth Father.
Documents reviewed:
• Team Decision Making (TDM) meeting held on 10/4/2024.
The meeting discussed communication which includes the
current placement and potential Foster Parent placement of
FC A. A discussion was held regarding the school not
having any paperwork such as a new court order. FC A
was made a temporary court ward on 8/22/2025. Updated
information on FC A came from the hospital and the TDM
facilitator. Information provided that FC A is in school, she
had an IEP on 10/3/2024, she is functioning around three
years old level. Paperwork from the hospital stated she
needs speech therapy; physical therapy was completed
through the hospital and needs a dental follow-up. FC A’s
hearing and vision optical was completed on 10/10/24. Her
dental examination/follow up was completed on 8/23/2024
and 9/13/2025.
7

• Safety Plan dated 9/5/24, for FC A and her current Foster
Parent. This plan provided assessing the safety of FC A
while having supervised visits with her Birth father. In
summary, this plan provided detailed information on the
role and responsibilities to the Foster Parent regarding
what Birth Father could and could not do and what Foster
Parent needed to do if Birth Father did not comply with the
instructions/directions. For example, who to contact if Birth
Father violated the instructions including emergency
telephone numbers.
• Updated service plan completed by FCW dated 12/3/2024
– 2/26/2025, provided detailed information regarding
assessment of progress in achieving the permanency goal
for FC A. The FCW had a meeting with the Placement
Collaboration Unit (PCU) on FC A’s wellbeing. Principal as
well as School Social Worker was in attendance with this
meeting. The report summarized reasons for the
assessment of individual barriers to reunification.
Recommended court orders were also discussed in this
report. This updated service plan provided the permanency
goal for twelve months for FC A. The permanency goal of
reunification beyond twelve months is to return FC A to her
family with additional services that will be needed to reunify
the family.
Analysis The findings of this rule determined that the agency did reach out
to the school personnel and communicated information regarding
FC A’s needs by way of the TDM held on 10/4/2024, and the
safety plan that was put in place with strict instructions for the
Foster Parent and the Birth Father to follow and abide by as the
FCW assessed for safety towards reunification.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
8

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
5/28/2025
